sentences: Ei mees ega naine tahtnud lahutamisel lastest loobuda.
Jaan armastab Marit ega loobu temast kunagi.
Koliks linna elama, aga ei raatsi aiast loobuda.
context: The Estonian verb 'loobuma' means to end something voluntarily by giving it up or abandoning it. It can refer to giving up possessions, habits, rights, opportunities, or even people. This includes both giving up positive things (like quitting smoking) and negative things (giving up a bad habit), as well as declining offers or renouncing claims.
